title: Relative motion-carts launching darts at target

content.question: A cart equipped with a launcher launches a dart horizontally, as shown. The dart is always given the same horizontal velocity <math alttext="v sub dart" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>dart </mtext></msub></mstyle></math> relative to the cart. In Trial <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the cart is at rest at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> a distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math> from a target and launches the dart toward the target. The dart takes a time <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> to reach the target. In Trial <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the cart is moving toward the target with constant speed <math alttext="v sub cart" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>cart </mtext></msub></mstyle></math> and launches the dart at the instant the cart is at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>. The dart takes a time <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> to reach the target. The cart has a negligible change in speed during the launch. Which of the following is a correct expression for the cart’s speed <math alttext="v sub cart" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>cart </mtext></msub></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator D, and denominator t sub 1, plus t sub 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>D</mi><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator D, and denominator t sub 1, minus t sub 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>D</mi><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator D, and denominator t sub 1, end fraction, plus the fraction with numerator D, and denominator t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>D</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mi>D</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator D, and denominator t sub 2, end fraction, minus the fraction with numerator D, and denominator t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>D</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac></mstyle><mo>-</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>D</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator D, and denominator t sub 2, end fraction, minus the fraction with numerator D, and denominator t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>D</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac></mstyle><mo>-</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>D</mi><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
